text: 3. Consider a projectile of mass m fired vertically upward in a constant gravitational field g. The direction of the gravitational field is downward. The initial velocity of the projectile is v(0) = v.. Calculate the time, tm, required for the projectile to reach maximum height for the case of (@) zero resisting force: F, = 0. (b) a resisting force proportional to the square of the velocity of the projectile: Fr = - ¢ V2, with ¢ being a positive constant.
